constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACH Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
PROPST P19d The Kingston Gas Holder Station

description: Details required by Condition 21 (CO2 emissions) of Planning Permission 14/12215/FUL (Redevelopment of site comprising erection of building between 5 and 9 storeys in height to provide 315 residential units and 408 sqm of community, education and/or commercial space (D1/A1,A2,A3, or B1) on Sury Basin frontage; formation of new vehicular access off Seven Kings Way to serve basement car park; provision of pubic open space and associated landscaping.)
decision_conditions: The details submitted for Condition 21 (CO2 Emissions) of Planning Permission 14/12215/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory and this condition is hereby fully discharged.

The Party Wall Act 1996 requires a building owner to notify, and obtain formal agreement from, any adjoining owner, where the building owner proposes to:- carry out work to an existing party wall;- build on the boundary with a neighbouring property;- in some circumstances, carry out groundwork's within 6 metres of an adjoining building.Notification and agreements under this Act are the responsibility of the building owner and are quite separate from Building Regulations, or Planning Controls.  The Building Control Service will assume that an applicant has obtained any necessary agreements with the adjoining owner, and nothing said or implied by the Council should be taken as removing the necessity for the building owner to comply fully with the Party Wall Act. Further information and advice is to be found in "The Party Walls etc. Act 1996 - Explanatory Booklet".

The fee required for your pre-planning application is Â£ 600.00.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or online via the Kingston council website.
